*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Elias R Wightman, March 12, 1830. Surveying, school, instructions for obtaining Land titles.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Matagorda*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="03-12-1830">Friday March 12 1830*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dr Sir*/p*
*p*I have been here and at the *location_mentioned*old landing opposite*/location_mentioned* this, since last *date_mentioned n="03-01-1830">Monday week*/date_mentioned*, and am compelled to leave for *location_mentioned*Brazoria */location_mentioned*without seeing you, which is a very serious disappointment.*/p*
*p*It was my original intention that you should have the surveying of *location_mentioned*all the vacant lands on this river below *person_mentioned*H. H. League*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*Betts*/person_mentioned**/location_mentioned*, and all *location_mentioned*Trespalacios*/location_mentioned*, *location_mentioned*Prairie*/location_mentioned*, and *location_mentioned*Cany Creek below *person_mentioned*Curtis*/person_mentioned**/location_mentioned*, and I fully expected you at *location_mentioned*San Felipe*/location_mentioned* when the *person_mentioned*Commissioner */person_mentioned*was there. But you did not come, and I heard you had engaged in a *location_mentioned*school*/location_mentioned* which I of course supposed would occupy all your time and as I heard nothing from you, was left to conclude that you did not wish for any surveying. Notwithstanding this, however, when *person_mentioned*Selkerk */person_mentioned*came over I wrote you, and stated that this job had been intended for you, and if you wished it, to go on with it, or if not to let *person_mentioned*Selkerk */person_mentioned*have your compass so that he might do it, or for you and him to do it jointly, or make any arrangement with him on the subject you thought proper and could make. My object was to get the work done without delay. About 18 days after *person_mentioned*Selkerk */person_mentioned*left me to come over here, I went to the *location_mentioned*mouth of Karankaway on the east side*/location_mentioned* and *location_mentioned*along the bay in sight of the timber of Trespalacios*/location_mentioned*, and thence *location_mentioned*up that Creek on the west side*/location_mentioned* in search of you or *person_mentioned*Selkerk*/person_mentioned*, but seeing no smokes in that direction, I could not but conclude from the time that had elapsed, that something had prevented either of you from starting, and that you had abandoned the job, I was alone and on a borrowed mule, and thought it very doubtfull wheither I could get over at this place, and therefore struck *location_mentioned*a north course for *location_mentioned**person_mentioned*Alley*/person_mentioned*s*/location_mentioned*.*/location_mentioned* On my arrival there I met *person_mentioned*Burnham*/person_mentioned*, who informed me you was to start from here in a few days. I only remained three days at home, and then proceeded to the head of *location_mentioned*Trespalacios */location_mentioned*send followed it down untill I found *person_mentioned*Selkerk */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Cook */person_mentioned*and directed them to stop at *location_mentioned*the west point of Trespalacios Bay*/location_mentioned*, for I had left orders for *person_mentioned*Ingram */person_mentioned*to finish the *location_mentioned*east side of Karankaway*/location_mentioned*. I expected to find you here, and that the whole meandering could be ploted in two or three days and the tracts all laid off on the map, after which they could have been run, but your absence has totally deranged all my calculations, and compelled me to make new arrangements, for I must be at *location_mentioned*Brazoria */location_mentioned*on *date_mentioned n="03-14-1830">Sunday */date_mentioned*or *date_mentioned n="03-15-1830">Monday */date_mentioned*next*/p*
*p*I wish you to make a connected plot of all the meanderings on a scale of 2000 varas to the inch, which is the scale used in all the work, and I will try and return here sometime in *date_mentioned n="05-xx-1830">May */date_mentioned*or *date_mentioned n="06-xx-1830">June*/date_mentioned*, or if you can send the plot up to the *location_mentioned*office */location_mentioned*I can there lay oil the tracts as they are taken, for there is to be some *location_mentioned*quarters */location_mentioned*and some *location_mentioned*Leagues */location_mentioned*intermixed, I shall be at *location_mentioned*Brazoria */location_mentioned*about 10 days, from there to *location_mentioned*Galveston bay*/location_mentioned*, by way of *location_mentioned*San Felipe*/location_mentioned*, and thence *location_mentioned*up the Colorado above the San Antonio road*/location_mentioned*, so that you see I have work chalked for myself until *date_mentioned n="06-xx-1830">June */date_mentioned*at least, and it is in fact quite doubtful whether I can be here again before *date_mentioned n="Fall - 1830">next fall*/date_mentioned* or *date_mentioned n="Winter - 1830">winter*/date_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*Another matter The *person_mentioned*families */person_mentioned*who came with you to the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned* have never been to the *location_mentioned*office*/location_mentioned*. I know not where they all want their land, ever since the *date_mentioned n="11-20-1829">20 of Novr last*/date_mentioned* they were informed by my advertisement what they ought to do. they have neglected their own affairs and if they suffer for so doing, they can blame no one buf themselves. I wrote you that all their business should be done without advancing one cent except the stamp paper which is fifty cents for each, so that they have no excuse,*/p*
*p*I will once more inform what they must do. They must each of them, (that is the *person_mentioned*heads of families*/person_mentioned*) go in person to the *location_mentioned*office */location_mentioned*and there enter their names and a list of their *person_mentioned*families */person_mentioned*and each one must take the oath prescribed by law and procure a certificate of reception as *person_mentioned*settlers */person_mentioned*in my *location_mentioned*colony*/location_mentioned*, and they must each of them state where they want their *location_mentioned*land */location_mentioned*and have an entry made of it. When this is done it can be surveyed and not before. This is too important a matter to be neglected any longer. If they take money to pay the stamp paper they can have their petitions made out in Spanish by *person_mentioned*Williams */person_mentioned*and sign it, and then they need not return to *location_mentioned*San Felipe*/location_mentioned* any more untill they go after their titles. Will you do those *person_mentioned*families */person_mentioned*the favor to attend to this matter and inform them what they must do. *person_mentioned*Williams */person_mentioned*will be at the *location_mentioned*office */location_mentioned*if I am not and can do all that is necessary.*/p*
*p*The object of the certificate of reception is to place a legal document in the hands of each one, that he was recd, as a *person_mentioned*settler */person_mentioned*by me under my contract with gvt. and as such is entitled in virtue of my contracts and the law to a certain *location_mentioned*portion of land*/location_mentioned*. I have adopted this plan for the safety of the *person_mentioned*emigrants */person_mentioned*in case of my death before they get their titles in full, for should I die at this time what legal proof have any of the *person_mentioned*families */person_mentioned*who came with you that they form a part of my *person_mentioned*settlers */person_mentioned*? they have none for there can be no legal register of their names untill they have taken the oath. I wish this matter attended to, for it is becoming rather dangerous to calculate too much on my life. My health is greatly impaired and is getting worse, and I have reason to fear that in case of my death, the *person_mentioned*emigrants */person_mentioned*would have to wait a long time before they get their titles. I therefore again repeat: neglect this matter no longer.*/p*
*p*It was my wish to come to some final plan as to this *location_mentioned*place*/location_mentioned*—but your absence has defeated that, and it must be defered to some other period. There is in human affairs a certain time, a point when the iron is hot, which ought never to be neglected—that point in your affairs was when the *person_mentioned*commissioner */person_mentioned*was at my *location_mentioned*house*/location_mentioned*. You could then have had all your affairs arranged, and now I fear there will be some difficulty to get a tract for you as the *person_mentioned*heirs */person_mentioned*of your deed, father, but all that can be done by me shall he done. A petition in Spanish must be drawn up on stamp paper and signed by you and the other *person_mentioned*heirs*/person_mentioned*, and I will then manage it to the best advantage for you, but untill I get that petition with the signatures to it I can do nothing for you.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*/div1*
